column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

A substantial rise of 265 head saw agents yard 871 cattle. Condition improving each week, Cow numbers totalling around 120, balance primarily well-bred weaners and small offerings of yearling types. Most of the good rises in the market last week evaporated selling to a mostly cheaper market.
 
Light weaner steers 300c to 452c/kg averaging 383c/kg back 50c/kg, over 330kg sold from 334c to 398c/kg to both re-stock and feed, B muscle Butcher calves made to a top of 366c/kg. Light weaner heifers back 14c/kg selling from 270c to 344c/kg, medium weights were steady making from 316c to 358c/kg and over 330kg to the butchers making to 340c/kg.
 
Medium and heavy re-stocker and feeder steers held firm trading from 340c to 396c/kg, similar traits for yearling heifers 310c to 328c/kg. Heavy grown steers to the Processors 322c to 332c/kg slipping around 12c/kg.
 
Light 2 score Cows were 15c/kg cheaper to the exporters selling from 142c to 262c/kg however to the re-stockers firm to slightly dearer 190c to 278c/kg. The heavy prime Cows slipped 4c/kg selling from 294c to 322c/kg. Best heavy Bull made 284c/kg.
 
Market Operator Angus Barlow.
